But speak thou the things which become sound doctrine:
That the aged men be sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, in charity, in patience.<RF>sober: or, vigilant<Rf>

The aged women likewise, that <FI>they be<Fi> in behaviour as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things;<RF>holiness: or, holy women<Rf><RF>false…: or, one who foments strife<Rf>
That they may teach the young women to be sober, to love their husbands, to love their children,<RF>sober: or, wise<Rf>
<FI>To be<Fi> discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.
Young men likewise exhort to be sober minded.<RF>sober…: or, discreet<Rf>
In all things shewing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine <FI>shewing<Fi> uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity,
Sound speech, that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you.
<FI>Exhort<Fi> servants to be obedient unto their own masters, <FI>and<Fi> to please <FI>them<Fi> well in all <FI>things<Fi>; not answering again;<RF>answering…: or, gainsaying<Rf>
Not purloining, but shewing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.<CM>
For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men,<RF>hath…: or, to all men, hath appeared<Rf>
Teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly, in this present world;

Looking for that blessed hope, and the glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ;<RF>glorious…: Gr. the appearance of the glory of the great God, and of our Saviour Jesus Christ<Rf>
Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.<CM>
These things speak, and exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no man despise thee.<CM>
